  1{

  3  {
  4   "attachments": {},
  5   "cell_type": "markdown",
  6   "metadata": {},
  7   "source": [
  8    "How to  Calculate the Yamada Polynomial of a Spatial Topology\n",
  9    "\n",
 10    "Ultimately, one of our research goals is to create a program that can take in a spatial diagram and calculate its Yamada polynomial. This workbook notebook partially implements this; future notebooks will see it through to completion.\n",
 11    "\n",
 12    "Current workflow: The user chooses a 3D model --> The user manually labels the vertices, edges, and crossings --> The program calculates the Yamada polynomial\n",
 13    "\n",
 14    "Future workflow: The user chooses a 3D model --> The program automatically extracts the vertices, edges, and crossings --> The program calculates the Yamada polynomial\n",
 15    "\n",
 16    "Notes:\n",
 17    "1. Code Validation:\n",
 18    "2. Edge Inflation: While the calculator works by operating on Vertex, Edge, and Crossing classes, it can still calculate Yamada polynomials without the user explicitly defining edges. The _inflate_edges method of the SpatialGraphDiagram class automatically intializes edges where they are implicitly defined by the vertices and crossings.\n",
 19    "3. Normalizing Yamada Polynomials"
 20   ]
 21  },
 22  {
 23   "attachments": {},
 24   "cell_type": "markdown",
 25   "metadata": {},
 26   "source": [
 27    "## Importing the necessary functions"
 28   ]
 29  },
 30  {
 31   "cell_type": "code",
 32   "execution_count": 1,
 33   "metadata": {},
 34   "outputs": [],
 35   "source": [
 36    "from yamada.calculation import (Vertex, Edge, Crossing,\n",
 37    "    SpatialGraphDiagram, normalize_poly)\n"
 38   ]
 39  },

 45    "## Calculate the Yamada Polynomial of an Infinity Symbol\n",
 46    "\n",
 47    "![Infinity Symbol](./images/infinity_symbol.png)"
 48   ]
 49  },
 50  {
 51   "cell_type": "code",
 52   "execution_count": 2,
 53   "metadata": {},
 54   "outputs": [
 55    {
 56     "name": "stdout",
 57     "output_type": "stream",
 58     "text": [
 59      "Infinity Symbol Yamada Polynomial: A^3 + A^2 + A\n"
 60     ]
 61    }
 62   ],
 63   "source": [
 64    "C = Crossing('X')\n",
 65    "\n",
 66    "C[0], C[2] = C[1], C[3]\n",
 67    "\n",
 68    "D = SpatialGraphDiagram([C])\n",
 69    "\n",
 70    "yamada_polynomial_infinity_symbol = D.yamada_polynomial()\n",
 71    "\n",
 72    "print(\"Infinity Symbol Yamada Polynomial:\", yamada_polynomial_infinity_symbol)"
 73   ]
 74  },

 76   "attachments": {},
 77   "cell_type": "markdown",
 78   "metadata": {},
 79   "source": [
 80    "## Calculate the Yamada Polynomial of an Unknotted Theta Graph\n",
 81    "\n",
 82    "Vertices: A and B\n",
 83    "Edges: E0, E1, and E2\n",
 84    "\n",
 85    "\n",
 86    "![Unknotted Theta Graph](./images/unknotted_theta_graph.png)"
 87   ]
 88  },
 89  {
 90   "cell_type": "code",
 91   "execution_count": 3,
 92   "metadata": {},
 93   "outputs": [
 94    {
 95     "name": "stdout",
 96     "output_type": "stream",
 97     "text": [
 98      "Unknotted Theta Graph Yamada Polynomial: (-A^4 - A^3 - 2*A^2 - A - 1)/A^2\n"
 99     ]
100    }
101   ],
102   "source": [
103    "A, B = Vertex(3, 'A'), Vertex(3, 'B')\n",
104    "\n",
105    "E0, E1, E2 = Edge(0), Edge(1), Edge(2)\n",
106    "\n",
107    "A[0], A[1], A[2] = E0[0], E1[0], E2[0]\n",
108    "\n",
109    "B[0], B[1], B[2] = E0[1], E2[1], E1[1]\n",
110    "\n",
111    "D = SpatialGraphDiagram([A, B, E0, E1, E2])\n",
112    "\n",
113    "print(\"Unknotted Theta Graph Yamada Polynomial:\", D.yamada_polynomial() )"
114   ]
115  },

121    "## Calculate the Yamada Polynomial of an Omega-2 Graph\n",
122    "\n",
123    "![Omega-2 Graph](./images/omega_2_graph.png)"
124   ]
125  },
126  {
127   "cell_type": "code",
128   "execution_count": 6,
129   "metadata": {},
130   "outputs": [
131    {
132     "name": "stdout",
133     "output_type": "stream",
134     "text": [
135      "Omega-2 Graph Yamada Polynomial: (A^13 + A^11 + A^10 - A^9 + A^8 - 2*A^7 + A^6 - A^5 + A^4 + A^3 + A^2 + A + 1)/A^5\n",
136      "Omega-2 Graph Yamada Polynomial: -A^13 - A^11 - A^10 + A^9 - A^8 + 2*A^7 - A^6 + A^5 - A^4 - A^3 - A^2 - A - 1\n"
137     ]
138    }
139   ],
140   "source": [
141    "A, B, C, D = [Vertex(3, L) for L in 'ABCD']\n",
142    "X, Y, Z = [Crossing(L) for L in 'XYZ']\n",
143    "\n",
144    "A[0], A[1], A[2] = D[0], B[2], X[2]\n",
145    "B[0], B[1] = C[0], X[3]\n",
146    "C[1], C[2] = D[2], Z[0]\n",
147    "D[1] = Z[1]\n",
148    "X[0], X[1] = Y[3], Y[2]\n",
149    "Y[0], Y[1] = Z[3], Z[2]\n",
150    "\n",
151    "D = SpatialGraphDiagram([A, B, C, D, X, Y, Z])\n",
152    "\n",
153    "yp_omega_2 = D.yamada_polynomial()\n",
154    "# yp_omega_2_norm = n\n",
155    "\n",
156    "print(\"Omega-2 Graph Yamada Polynomial:\", yp_omega_2 )\n",
157    "\n",
158    "nyp_omega_2 = D.normalized_yamada_polynomial()\n",
159    "# yp_omega_2_norm = n\n",
160    "\n",
161    "print(\"Omega-2 Graph Yamada Polynomial:\", nyp_omega_2 )"
162   ]
163  },

170    "\n",
171    "![Trivalent Spatial Topology](./images/trivalent_spatial_topology.png)\n",
172    "\n",
173    "Vertices:\n",
174    "Crossings:"
175   ]

177  {
178   "cell_type": "code",
179   "execution_count": 5,
180   "metadata": {},
181   "outputs": [
182    {
183     "name": "stdout",
184     "output_type": "stream",
185     "text": [
186      "Yamada Polynomial: (A^12 - A^11 - 4*A^8 + A^7 - 6*A^6 + A^5 - 4*A^4 - A + 1)/A^6\n"
187     ]
188    }
189   ],
190   "source": [
191    "A,B,C,D,E,F = [Vertex(3,L) for L in 'ABCDEF']\n",
192    "X, Y = [Crossing(L) for L in 'XY']\n",
193    "\n",
194    "A[0], A[1], A[2] = X[3], B[1], Y[0]\n",
195    "B[0], B[2] = C[1], D[1]\n",
196    "C[0], C[2] = Y[1], E[0]\n",
197    "D[0], D[2] = E[1], X[2]\n",
198    "E[2] = F[0]\n",
199    "F[1], F[2] = X[1], Y[2]\n",
200    "X[0] = Y[3]\n",
201    "\n",
202    "\n",
203    "D = SpatialGraphDiagram([A,B,C,D,E,F,X,Y])\n",
204    "\n",
205    "yamada_polynomial_trivalent_spatial_topology = D.yamada_polynomial()\n",
206    "\n",
207    "print('Yamada Polynomial:', yamada_polynomial_trivalent_spatial_topology)"
208   ]
